Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <Oink> The community decided not to market anything until there is something to market. We can go big on selling PBaaS now, but as long as it is not implemented on main net, it'll be like selling hot air in the desert. We started to let the world know about PBaaS once it was on testnet, so people could experience it for themselves.
We are now starting to actively market Verus (K64 gaming conference in The Hague withg Micheal Tout jr for example)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> Actually, their approach is basically the same. The only real difference is how you can trust notarizations.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> The big thing about the fly client paper is that the approach allows someone to trust an incomplete chain because the MMR-based proof of work (in Verus we do proof of power), makes it statistically impossible to present a fake chain as real, and you can then use the most work rule to select.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> At the end of that, just as with Verus cross-chain notarization, there is the merkle mountain range root that you can trust

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> just as with Komodo notarization, there is a merkle of merkles of merkles that you can trust through the elected notarization process

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> I was thinking also that we should enable the PBaaS cross chain notarization to allow a trusted notary body or group of notaries, like the Komodo notaries, to be commissioned by a chain and earn as a notary group to more quickly cross-notarize a PBaaS chain, enabling faster confirmations than the fully decentralized notarization if the chain creators wanted to make that tradeoff
